qas.question: Who searched for specifically Slavic sub-group of R1a1a [M17]?
When did Marcin Woźniak search specifically for Slavic sub-group of R1a1a [M17]?
The team that discovered M458 was led by who?
Who was searching for Slavic haplotypes?
When did Peter Underhill discover the marker?
What did Peter Underhill suspect M458 was?
What is the evolutionary effective mutation rate more in line with?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Marcin Woźniak<b3_0/> and colleagues<a0_0/> (<a1_0><b4_0>2010<b4_0/><a1_0/>) searched for specifically Slavic sub-group of R1a1a [M17]. Working with haplotypes, they found a pattern among Western Slavs which turned out to correspond to a newly discovered marker, <b7_0>M458<b7_0/>, which defines subclade R1a1a7. This marker correlates remarkably well with the distribution of Slavic-speakers today. The team led by <a2_0>Peter Underhill<a2_0/>, which discovered M458, did not consider the possibility that this was <b5_0>a Slavic marker<b5_0/>, since they used the "evolutionary effective" mutation rate, which gave a date far too old to be Slavic. Woźniak and colleagues pointed out that the pedigree mutation rate, giving a later date, is more consistent with <b6_0>the archaeological record<b6_0/>.
